Title.evidence: we conducted a randomized, phase II study

Trial_Design.evidence: Nineteen GIST patients undergoing surgical resection were randomized

Participants.evidence: Nineteen GIST patients undergoing surgical resection

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive 3, 5, or 7 days of preoperative imatinib (600 mg daily). Patients received postoperative imatinib for 2 years.

Objective.evidence: to assess the safety and efficacy of preoperative and postoperative imatinib for the treatment of GIST.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The efficacy of imatinib was assessed by 18 fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography ( 18 FDG-PET), dynamic computed tomography (dCT), terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick end labeling (TUNEL) assay, and DFS.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Nineteen GIST patients undergoing surgical resection were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median DFS of patients treated with surgery and imatinib was 46 months (range 10–46 months).

Harms.evidence: Imatinib did not affect surgical morbidity as compared with an imatinib-naïve cohort ( p ≥ 0.1).
